title: The Mandalorian season 3 has been delayed—but only a little
description: It's the first new season of the show since 2020—well, sort of.

title: Over a year later, Musk’s Neuralink still 6 months from human trials
description: Lots of tech in development, but we're still waiting for indications of an application.

title: OpenAI invites everyone to test new AI-powered chatbot—with amusing results
description: ChatGPT aims to produce accurate and harmless talk—but it's a work in progress.

title: More Eufy camera flaws found, including remote, unencrypted feed viewing
description: You can stream footage from cameras' "local storage" from anywhere using VLC.

title: Hive Social turns off servers after researchers warn hackers can access all data
description: Site officials say site will be down for a couple of days.

title: Sam Bankman-Fried speaks on FTX collapse: “I didn’t ever try to commit fraud”
description: Bankman-Fried does public interview despite his lawyers urging him to stay quiet.

title: Pixel 7a rumors show similar design, big tech upgrades
description: A 90 Hz display, wireless charging, and modern cameras make this a phone to watch.

title: Nintendo apologizes for Pokémon performance problems, promises “improvements”
description: Games have been Nintendo's fastest-selling titles despite early bugs.

title: Call of Duty players flock to buy “all-black” DLC skin, hide in dark corners
description: LA Thieves skin pack becomes a bestseller by offering in-game camouflage effect.

title: Google game honors Black video game pioneer Jerry Lawson on his birthday
description: Late engineer played key role in creating first cartridge-based console in 1976.

title: Astronomers say a new, huge satellite is as bright as the brightest stars
description: "BlueWalker 3 is a big shift in the constellation satellite issue."

title: Elon Musk appears to reconcile with Apple after Twitter tirade
description: Musk: "misunderstanding" over Twitter and the App Store is resolved.

title: My secret life as an 11-year-old BBS sysop
description: Revisiting the wonder and betrayal of online life circa 1992.

title: Chrome, Defender, and Firefox 0-days linked to commercial IT firm in Spain
description: Variston IT fingerprints found in source code for advanced Chrome exploit.
